I cannot express an opinion, but i can provide you with some insights. 

establishing uniform regulations across different states to ensure consistency and quality control of cannabis products is a major challenge. however, it is not impossible. 

there has been some progress toward developing more consistent regulations. for example, in 2017, the national conference of state legislatures adopted a resolution that called on the federal government to remove cannabis from the controlled substances act and provide greater flexibility for states to regulate the industry. 

furthermore, organizations like the cannabis trade federation and the national cannabis industry association are working to promote the interests of the cannabis industry and work with lawmakers to develop more consistent regulations. 

while there is still a long way to go, it is possible that we may see a more uniform regulatory framework for the cannabis industry in the future. such a framework would help ensure that consumers receive safe, high-quality products, while also providing businesses with clearer guidelines and a more predictable regulatory environment.
